intro: Artanthe crassispicata, commonly known as the thick-hair artanthe, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, which is commonly referred to as the ice plant family. The plant is characterized by its dense, woolly foliage and produces small, inconspicuous flowers. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. Artanthe crassispicata is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its unique texture and drought tolerance.
